title: Google Sneakily Adds in UI Changes to Android Auto
description: The changes come with Android Auto version 13.4. The post Google Sneakily Adds in UI Changes to Android Auto appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: The changes come with Android Auto version 13.4.
text: If you use a device with support for Android Auto, then you might want to check and see if Google’s new UI changes have appeared for your interface. As reported by the folks over at 9to5Google, new Material You accent colors have started to show up in the latest updates for Android Auto users. READ: Google wants to Streamline App Development for Android Auto These changes come with Android Auto version 13.4. There’s not a lot of changes under the hood, although the new Material You theme additions do add a bit of variety to the software interface, similar to what we’re seeing on Google Pixel smartphones. Some screenshots below from the 9to5Google team show accent colors on some UI elements including the Settings menu and notifications. While the Android Auto colors are designed to match the rest of your device’s UI, there are some inconsistencies which seem to indicate that the new update isn’t the final version. In any case, we’re bound to see more refinements in future Android Auto updates. Source: 9to5Google A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. html:
If you use a device with support for Android Auto, then you might want to check and see if Google’s new UI changes have appeared for your interface. As reported by the folks over at 9to5Google, new Material You accent colors have started to show up in the latest updates for Android Auto users.

READ: Google wants to Streamline App Development for Android Auto

These changes come with Android Auto version 13.4. There’s not a lot of changes under the hood, although the new Material You theme additions do add a bit of variety to the software interface, similar to what we’re seeing on Google Pixel smartphones. Some screenshots below from the 9to5Google team show accent colors on some UI elements including the Settings menu and notifications.

While the Android Auto colors are designed to match the rest of your device’s UI, there are some inconsistencies which seem to indicate that the new update isn’t the final version. In any case, we’re bound to see more refinements in future Android Auto updates.

Source: 9to5Google

A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart.
